text: * Tooth structure — Each tooth has two major regions: » Crown: exposed part above gingiva (gum) — Covered by enamel, the hardest substance in body » Heavily mineralized with calcium salts and hydroxyapatite crystals » Enamel-producing cells degenerate when tooth erupts, so no healing if tooth decays or cracks; needs artificial repair by filling * Root: portion embedded in jawbone — Connected to crown by neck
